metadata.title: USN-6467-1 -- Kerberos vulnerability
metadata.description: Robert Morris discovered that Kerberos did not properly handle memory access when processing RPC data through kadmind, which could lead to the freeing of uninitialized memory. An authenticated remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause kadmind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6467-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libk5crypto3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-kpropd - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkdb5-9 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-user - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libgssrpc4 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkrb5support0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-doc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkrb5-dev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-pkinit - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkrb5-3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-otp - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-gss-samples - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-multidev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-locales - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-kdc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkrad-dev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-k5tls - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkrad0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 krb5-admin-server - 1.16-2ubuntu0.4+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
